result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Lamon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 158 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha Metro Drug Unit as a condition of extended supervision.

No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael M Lamon in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1

Imposed Sentence of:

8 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 158 days ) Concurrent to any other sentence
4 Years of Initial Confinement
4 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

Seek full time employment;

Buy Money:  $160.00 to Waukesha Metro Drug Unit as a condition of extended superivison

Cost: Waived
 
DNA surcharge: Waived
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant to be returned to Fox Lake Correctional Institution as soon as possible
